Miscellaneous Highlights: The Orioles will wear their City Connect jerseys at each Friday home game throughout the regular season, and this year, every City Connect Friday will be dedicated to Harlem Park Elementary Middle School.

Fans can purchase single game tickets for all regular season home games, including when the Oâ€™s take on the Chicago White Sox from September 2-4 and the Tampa Bay Rays from September 6-8, by visiting Orioles.com/Tickets.

The Orioles will host a 50/50 Raffle at each regular season home game to benefit a charity in the Baltimore community and the Ted Williams Foundation, giving fans the opportunity to make a direct impact across Birdland while trying to hit the jackpot at Camden Yards.
Others: The Orioles will donate tickets to the families of three young Orioles fans who passed away from cancer in the last year.
The Orioles will provide tickets to the families of children who are currently being treated for cancer and who participated in the 2024 Maryland Trek.
The Orioles will donate tickets to ADAPTIVE ATHLETICS FOUNDATION OF MARYLAND as part of their Heroes Corner program, presented by The Good Feet Store.
The Orioles will donate tickets to FIELDS 4 VALOR FARMS as part of their Heroes Corner program, presented by The Good Feet Store.
The Orioles will donate tickets to STUDENT SUPPORT NETWORK as part of their Heroes Corner program, presented by The Good Feet Store.
The Orioles will donate tickets to JUMP 4 VALOR to the ballpark as part of their Military Suites Program, presented by RBR-Technologies.
Other Details: The Orioles will recognize CLYDE, an 8-year-old from Severna Park, who is battling two types of cancer, as their Birdland Community Hero.
The Orioles will recognize 12-year-old CAMERON, the founder of SOUL MAN SWEETS, an in-home baking business, as their Birdland Community Hero.
